item.title: SK 集团董事长称，人工智能数据中心的快速发展造成了瓶颈
item.description: SK 集团董事长崔泰源（Chey Tae-won）周二表示，人工智能数据中心的爆炸式增长正在为芯片和其他关键供应品制造 "瓶颈"。【原文：The explosive growth in artificial intelligence data centres is creating "bottlenecks" for chips and other key supplies, SK Group Chairman Chey Tae-won said on Tuesday.】

item.title: 比亚迪的微型汽车野心可能会为日本敲响警钟
item.description: 比亚迪的日本微型车要到明年年底才能上市，但它已经引起了热议--至少在担心来自中国最大汽车制造商挑战的东京官员中是这样。【原文：BYD's Japanese mini-car will not go on sale until the end of next year, but it has already created buzz - at least among officials in Tokyo worried about the challenge from China's biggest automaker.】

item.title: 野村报告第二季度净利润下降 6
item.description: 日本最大的经纪和投资银行野村控股公司周二报告称，该公司 7-9 月份的净利润下降了 6%。【原文：Japan's largest brokerage and investment bank Nomura Holdings reported on Tuesday a 6% drop in net profit over the July-September quarter.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，苹果供应商 Skyworks 曾洽谈以 80 亿美元收购竞争对手 Qorvo
item.description: The Information 周二援引知情人士的话报道称，为苹果和其他智能手机制造商提供射频芯片的 Skyworks Solutions 最近几个月就收购竞争对手 Qorvo 进行了谈判。【原文：Skyworks Solutions , which supplies radio frequency chips to Apple and other smartphone makers, held talks in recent months to buy rival Qorvo , The Information reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 世创电子材料下调 2025 年利润率预期
item.description: 世创电子材料（Siltronic）本周二发布的季度财报显示，受汇率负面影响以及交付工作转入下一季度的影响，该公司的年度核心利润率前景有所收窄。【原文：Siltronic on Tuesday narrowed its annual core profit margin outlook after posting a weaker-than-expected quarterly profit, impacted by negative currency effects and deliveries shifting into the next quarter.】

item.title: 凯捷公布第三季度有机增长 3% 后上调增长预期
item.description: 法国IT咨询公司凯捷（Capgemini）周二表示，其第三季度收入有机增长了2.9%，并上调了增长预期，理由是人工智能解决方案需求稳健，北美市场表现强劲。【原文：French IT consulting firm Capgemini said its third-quarter revenue increased by 2.9% organically and raised its growth forecast on Tuesday, citing solid demand for AI solutions and strong performance in North America.】

item.title: 管理着 11.5 万亿美元资产的投资者敦促食品公司从动物蛋白向多元化发展
item.description: 管理着 11.5 万亿美元资产的投资者呼吁大型食品公司和零售商将产品多样化，增加植物性蛋白质来源，以提高供应链的弹性，降低食品安全风险。【原文：Investors managing $11.5 trillion in assets are calling on major food companies and retailers to diversify into more plant-based protein sources to enhance supply chain resiliency and mitigate food security risks.】

item.title: 聚焦：特朗普打击网络竞争对手，Primark 抓住美国机遇
item.description: Primark 正在加快在美国的开店速度，并加大营销力度，押注美国总统唐纳德-特朗普取消电子商务包裹免税的举措将促使有预算意识的购物者远离网络竞争对手，回到商店购物。【原文：Primark is accelerating its U.S. store openings and ramping up marketing, betting that President Donald Trump's move to scrap a duty exemption on e-commerce parcels will drive budget-conscious shoppers away from online rivals and back to stores.】

item.title: 海湾金融科技公司 Tabby 在二次售股后估值达 45 亿美元
item.description: 总部位于沙特阿拉伯的金融科技公司 Tabby 周二表示，该公司已完成涉及现有股东所持股份的二次股票出售，在可能的公开上市之前，公司估值达 45 亿美元。【原文：Saudi Arabia-headquartered fintech Tabby said on Tuesday it has completed a secondary share sale involving shares held by existing shareholders, valuing the company at $4.5 billion ahead of a potential public listing.】

item.title: 独家报道：随着美国食品及药物管理局行动的加快，BAT 暂停在美国推出未获许可的电子产品
item.description: 英美烟草公司（British American Tobacco）表示，随着美国食品和药物管理局（Food and Drug Administration）采取行动打击无管制产品并加快许可证发放速度，该公司已暂停在美国推出无许可证一次性吸食器的试点计划。【原文：British American Tobacco said it has paused a pilot plan to launch an unlicensed disposable vape in the U.S., as the Food and Drug Administration moves to crack down on unregulated products and speed up licences.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，英国电信集团正在探索新的移动品牌
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周二援引知情人士的话报道称，英国最大的宽带供应商英国电信集团正在酝酿推出一个低成本移动品牌。【原文：Britain's largest broadband provider BT Group is mulling the launch of a low-cost mobile brand, the Financial Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 研究显示，2025 年前九个月全球并购活动增长 10
item.description: 周二的一项研究显示，尽管美国关税政策和地缘政治冲突存在不确定性，但2025年前九个月的全球并购活动与去年同期相比增长了10%，延续了逐步复苏的态势。【原文：Global mergers and acquisitions activity grew 10% in the first nine months of 2025 compared with the same period last year, extending a gradual recovery despite uncertainty over U.S. tariff policies and geopolitical conflict, a study showed on Tuesday.】

item.title: 花旗集团将与 Coinbase 合作，为机构客户提供数字支付服务
item.description: 花旗集团和加密货币交易所 Coinbase 计划合作，为美国银行的机构客户提供数字资产支付解决方案，并在未来将产品扩展到全球客户。【原文：Citigroup and cryptocurrency exchange Coinbase plan to collaborate on digital asset payment solutions for the U.S. bank's institutional clients, to expand the offering to global clients in the future.】

item.title: 美国总统贝森特在与日本的会谈中强调 "稳健 "货币政策的必要性
item.description: 美国财政部周二发表声明称，美国财政部长斯科特-贝森特（Scott Bessent）在与日本财政部长片山聪树（Satsuki Katayama）的会晤中强调了 "稳健货币政策制定 "的关键作用。【原文：U.S. Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent highlighted the key role of "sound monetary policy formulation" during his meeting with Japanese counterpart Satsuki Katayama, the U.S. Treasury Department said in a statement on Tuesday.】

item.title: 早间竞标：棒球、高尔夫和诺贝尔奖
item.description: 韦恩-科尔对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望。【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Wayne Cole.】

item.title: 消息人士称，日本和美国有意投资三菱重工
item.description: 一位日本政府高级官员表示，日本和美国正在准备一份关于美国潜在投资项目的情况说明书，其中涉及三菱重工等日本公司。【原文：Japan and the United States are preparing a fact sheet on potential investment projects in the U.S., involving Japanese firms such as Mitsubishi Heavy Industries , a senior Japanese government official said.】

item.title: 澳大利亚多米诺比萨公司否认贝恩资本收购报道
item.description: 多米诺比萨企业周二否认收到贝恩资本（Bain Capital）的收购提议，此前有报道称这家私募股权公司正在考虑收购这家澳大利亚特许经营商的全部或部分股权。【原文：Domino's Pizza Enterprises on Tuesday denied receiving a takeover proposal from Bain Capital after a report said the private equity firm was looking at buying the whole or part of the Australian franchise operator.】

item.title: 汇丰银行第三季度利润因法律费用下滑 14%，但上调收入展望
item.description: 汇丰控股周二公布，第三季度税前利润下降 14%，原因是在与史上最大的庞氏骗局麦道夫（Bernard Madoff）的庞氏骗局有关的长期诉讼案中，汇丰控股在部分上诉中败诉，因此需要支付 11 亿美元的费用。【原文：HSBC Holdings reported a 14% decline in third-quarter pretax profit on Tuesday, hurt by a $1.1 billion charge after losing part of an appeal in a long-running lawsuit tied to Bernard Madoff's Ponzi scheme, history's biggest-ever such fraud.】

item.title: Meta、TikTok 和 Snap 表示反对澳大利亚的青少年社交媒体禁令，但将遵守该禁令
item.description: Instagram 的所有者 Meta 和其他社交媒体公司周二表示，他们将遵守对 16 岁以下用户的禁令，并补充说，一旦法律于 12 月 10 日生效，他们将开始停用账户。【原文：Instagram owner Meta and other social media firms said on Tuesday they will comply with a ban on users under the age of 16, adding that they will start deactivating accounts once the law takes effect on December 10.】

item.title: 特朗普与高市就稀土和关键矿物供应问题达成一致
item.description: 白宫在一份声明中说，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普和日本首相佐佐江-高市周二签署了一项框架协议，通过采矿和加工确保关键矿物和稀土的供应。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump and Japan Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi on Tuesday signed a framework agreement for securing the supply of critical minerals and rare earths through mining and processing, the White House said in a statement.】

item.title: 富士康将投资 13.7 亿美元建设人工智能计算集群和超级计算中心
item.description: 台湾富士康表示，其董事会已批准一项投资计划，为人工智能计算集群和超级计算中心采购设备，该计划将允许富士康花费高达 420 亿新台币（13.7 亿美元）。【原文：Taiwan’s Foxconn said its board of directors has approved an investment plan to procure equipment for a AI compute cluster and a supercomputing centre, that will allow it to spend up to NT$42 billion ($1.37 billion).】

item.title: 美元走软，交易员为特朗普与习近平及央行会议做准备
item.description: 美元周二走软，原因是美国央行将召开一系列会议，届时美国可能会降息，而且投资者对唐纳德-特朗普总统的亚洲之行保持警惕，希望与中国达成贸易协议。【原文：The dollar was weaker on Tuesday ahead of a slate of central bank meetings that will likely see a rate cut in the U.S. and as investors kept a wary eye on President Donald Trump's Asia tour, hoping for a trade deal with China.】

item.title: 欧佩克产量计划抵消中美贸易乐观预期，石油下跌
item.description: 周二油价下滑，延续了前两个交易日的跌势，原因是欧佩克（OPEC）提高产量计划带来的压力抵消了对中美可能达成贸易协议的乐观预期。【原文：Oil prices slipped on Tuesday, extending falls from the two previous sessions, as pressure from plans by OPEC to boost output offset optimism over a potential U.S.-China trade deal.】

item.title: 美日会谈的议程有哪些？
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普和日本首相佐那江隆一周二将在东京就安全和贸易问题举行会谈，这是他自2019年以来首次访问日本。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump and Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi are holding talks on security and trade in Tokyo on Tuesday, marking his first visit to Japan since 2019.】

item.title: 亚洲股市为财报和加息呼声稍事喘息
item.description: 周二，亚洲股市巩固了近期的大幅涨势，原因是对全球贸易紧张局势缓解的希望使风险偏好持续升温，而科技股的牛市则得益于本周大盘股财报的大丰收。【原文：Asian shares consolidated recent hefty gains on Tuesday as hopes for an easing in global trade tensions kept risk appetites keen, while the bull run in tech stocks counted on a bumper round of big-cap earnings this week.】

item.title: 受美国关税打击的中国与东盟签署升级版自由贸易协定
item.description: 东南亚集团东盟和中国周二签署了自由贸易协定的升级版，预计其中将包括数字、绿色经济和其他新兴产业部分。【原文：The Southeast Asian bloc ASEAN and China on Tuesday signed an upgrade to their free trade agreement, which is expected to include sections on digital, green economy and other new industries.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，派拉蒙计划在合并后基本保留华纳兄弟公司的业务
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周一报道，派拉蒙天舞公司计划，如果华纳兄弟发现公司与派拉蒙天舞公司合并，将保留两家公司的大部分业务，首席执行官大卫-埃里森（David Ellison）的目标是保留两家电影公司的创意团队，同时精简营销和发行。【原文：Paramount Skydance plans to keep much of Warner Bros Discovery intact if the two companies merge, with CEO David Ellison aiming to retain creative teams at both studios while streamlining marketing and distribution, Bloomberg News reported on Monday.】

item.title: 朝日新闻》称，高市和特朗普将签署关于确保稀土矿物安全的联合文件
item.description: 据《朝日新闻》周二报道，日本首相高市真奈和美国总统唐纳德-特朗普正在准备一份关于确保稀土和其他关键矿产以及加强供应链的联合文件，该工作已进入最后阶段。【原文：Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi and U.S. President Donald Trump are in the final stages of preparing a joint document on securing rare earths and other critical minerals and strengthening supply chains, the Asahi Newspaper reported on Tuesday.】

item.title: 出狱交易员汤姆-海斯（Tom Hayes）就 Libor 指控起诉瑞银，索赔 4 亿美元
item.description: 汤姆-海耶斯（Tom Hayes）是全球利差操纵丑闻的前交易员，在今年 7 月他的定罪被推翻之前，他起诉了他的前雇主瑞银集团，要求赔偿 4 亿多美元，称这家瑞士银行将他塑造成丑闻的 "邪恶主谋"，以庇护自己。【原文：Tom Hayes, the former trader who was a face of the global Libor-rigging scandal before his conviction was overturned in July, sued his former employer UBS for more than $400 million, saying the Swiss bank cast him as the "evil mastermind" of the scandal to shield itself.】

item.title: 荷兰政府因担心 Nexperia 遭到破坏而控制了 Nexperia - 消息来源
item.description: 海牙四位熟悉荷兰政府想法的消息人士周一表示，荷兰之所以决定在 9 月份控制芯片制造商 Nexperia，是因为担心该公司的前首席执行官已经在拆除公司的欧洲业务，并将生产转移到中国。【原文：The Netherlands' decision to take control of chipmaker Nexperia in September was due to fears the company's former CEO was already dismantling the company's European operations and moving production to China, four sources in The Hague familiar with the government's thinking said on Monday.】
